title: Residents of war-ravaged Sloviansk explain why they're staying
description: Residents in Sloviansk, Ukraine, must choose between staying behind or leaving their homes as war rages all around them.  CNN's Ben Wedeman reports on their difficult choice.

title: Simon Cowell shocked while watching himself perform through AI
description: Artificial intelligence has officially made Simon Cowell a performer without him even knowing. Watch the shocking deepfake in a preview of "America's Got Talent" season 17.

title: World Bank president on handling 'biggest slowdown of the global economy in 80 years'
description: The World Bank has dropped its global economic growth projection. Its president, David Malpass, explains why as he warns of stagflation, and suggests what could be done.

title: Video shows 12-year-old robbing gas station, firing gun
description: A 12-year-old was taken into custody after robbing a gas station at gunpoint in Michigan. The juvenile is facing felony charges, according to police.

title: 7-year-old boy surprised with mini UPS truck
description: 7-year-old Drew, who has Down syndrome, told everyone he wanted to be a UPS driver. Watch UPS surprise him with a miniature version of their truck. HLN's Robin Meade explains.

title: A sponge may not be the most hygienic way to clean dishes, study suggests, but there is an alternative
description: Kitchen sponges harbor more bacteria than kitchen brushes, which may be a more hygienic way to clean your dishes, according to researchers in Norway.

title: How the defense of Trump foretells a possible new GOP era of extremism
This is what it looks like to beg for Donald Trump's endorsement
description: Mo Brooks is desperate. And he wants Donald Trump to know it.

title: This iconic song is topping the charts 37 years after it was first released
description: Kate Bush's 1985 single "Running Up That Hill" is making a resurgence with a new global audience after featuring on Netflix's "Stranger Things."

title: Apple will be required to support USB-C charger under new EU policy
description: Apple and other smartphone makers will be required to support USB-C as part of a single charging standard for mobile devices across the European Union by as early as the fall of 2024 under a new law announced Tuesday by EU officials.

title: Teacher shot in Uvalde massacre recalls horror inside classroom where 11 of 19 slain students were killed
description: A teacher who was wounded in last month's massacre at a Texas elementary school told ABC his students were watching a movie when they heard gunshots -- and asked him what was going on.

title: Arizona investigators are reviewing officer conduct after a man drowned in a reservoir during a domestic dispute call
description: State and local agencies will investigate the death of a man in Tempe, Arizona, last month who drowned after police officers responding to a disturbance call did not enter the water to reach the man, city and state officials announced Monday.

title: Apologetic Phil Mickelson to return to golf at inaugural LIV Golf series tournament
description: Six-time golf major champion Phil Mickelson will participate in the inaugural LIV Golf tournament at the Centurion Club near London. The controversial series tees off Thursday.

title: 'Euphoria' star's outfit has the internet freaking out about latest fashion trend
description: "Euphoria" star Sydney Sweeney's "itsy bitsy teeny weeny micro mini" skirt at the MTV Movie & TV Awards drew strong reactions from the internet. CNN's Jeanne Moos wonders if it will bring back the dreaded low-rise look.

title: Opinion: How the US can stop relying on other countries for energy and fight climate change
description: Russia's move to cut off natural gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria, and more recently Finland, parts of Germany and potentially Denmark and the Netherlands, is just the latest salvo in its ongoing weaponization of energy for political purposes. If allowed to continue unchecked, the war in Ukraine will not only weaken geopolitical stability, but it will also worsen global warming. That's why it makes perfect sense in the short term for the US to increase both the amount of liquified natural gas (LNG) it exports to the European Union and countries across Asia and boost its investment in carbon-free energy production.

title: Michael B. Jordan and Lori Harvey split: Steve Harvey says he's 'Team Lori'
description: Steve Harvey is supporting his daughter after her reported breakup with actor Michael B. Jordan.

title: Ice skating set to gradually raise minimum competition age from 15 to 17 after Kamila Valieva doping scandal
description: The International Skating Union (ISU) announced on Tuesday that it will gradually increase the minimum age for senior competitions from 15 to 17.

title: 'Uninvestable' China could make a comeback
description: Foreign investors lost their nerve on parking money in China over the past year, as Beijing cracked down on the country's biggest tech companies, the real estate sector stumbled and coronavirus lockdowns crimped growth.

title: Burger King has a 'Pride Whopper' with 'two equal buns'
description: Burger King's new hamburger to celebrate Pride Month has caused quite the stir on social media.

title: Travel is back. And so are the influencers
description: Love them or loathe them, as the travel world re-opens, influencers are back on the move.

title: Ryanair under fire for asking South Africans to prove nationality with Afrikaans test
description: Ryanair has come under fire for asking South African travelers to take an Afrikaans test to prove their nationality before boarding flights.

title: This teacher was shot in the face at 17-years-old. Now, he teaches a controversial class to students
description: Firearm instructor Rufus Johnson is hoping to curb gun related incidents by bringing his gun safety trainings to schools in Cincinnati, OH.

title: What's next for Boris Johnson? Here's what you need to know
description:
• Opinion: The party is over for Boris Johnson
• Analysis: How long can PM cling to power?
• Analysis: Britain's economy is in a bad place. Removing Johnson might help

title: See town covered in ash after volcano eruption
description: Ash covered roads and homes in the aftermath of an eruption of the Bulusan volcano on June 5 in the Philippines.

title: Lettuce shortage forces KFC to offer cabbage in Australia
description: KFC has been forced to make menu changes again in Australia, as the fast food chain is hit with shortages of key ingredients. This time it's lettuce.

title: Trevor Reed calls for Brittney Griner's release as he details horrendous conditions of Russian detainment
description: Trevor Reed, the American veteran who spent nearly three years detained in Russia before being released in April in a prisoner swap, called upon legislators and the White House Monday to work faster toward freeing American basketball star Brittney Griner.

title: California is about to experience a political earthquake. Here's why
description: An earthquake is building in Tuesday's California elections that could rattle the political landscape from coast to coast.

title: 8 things to watch in Tuesday's primaries
description: Tuesday's primary elections in seven states will once again test whether Republican voters are willing to punish incumbents with track records of winning competitive races for failing to be sufficiently supportive of former President Donald Trump.

title: Three motorcyclists have died in this year's Isle of Man TT
description: Northern Irish rider Davy Morgan has become the third motorcyclist to die in a crash during this year's Isle of Man TT.

title: South Korean and US fighter jets in show of force to Kim Jong Un amid fears over North Korean nuclear test
description: South Korea and the United States put on an aerial show of force to North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on Tuesday, flying 20 fighter jets over waters west of the Korean Peninsula in response to Pyongyang's recent missile tests.

title: Teens are facing a sleep deprivation epidemic. Here's why
description: American teenagers aren't getting enough sleep these days, and author Lisa L. Lewis refuses to snooze on the issue anymore.

title: Bisa Butler's stunning quilted portraits celebrate Black identity and African roots
description: Brilliantly colored and full of visual drama, Bisa Butler's larger-than-life sized quilted portraits are nearly indistinguishable from paintings. Creating works that have appeared on the cover of Time Magazine, and sold at auction for up to $75,000, Butler is taking quilting into the realms of high art.

title: Alibaba and JD.com stocks rally on hopes tech crackdown may be over
description: Shares in Chinese tech companies have surged this week on hopes that Beijing is close to ending a yearlong regulatory crackdown on the industry.

title: Climate crisis costs up over 800% as UN donor nations fail to keep pace, report says
description: The amount of money needed to aid communities in the face of extreme weather-related emergencies has increased exponentially in the past two decades as the climate crisis also accelerated rapidly, new research shows.

title: The party is over for Boris Johnson
An 'unburnable' copy of 'The Handmaid's Tale' sells for $130,000 at auction
description: Margaret Atwood's "The Handmaid's Tale" has often provoked controversy, facing book bans over the decades since its release in 1985.

title: 'No way out': Commentator predicts Boris Johnson's future
description: CNN's Dominic Thomas predicts that UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson will not be able to hold onto power in the wake of a no-confidence vote where 148 MPs in his own party voted to oust him.

title: Judge rules Oklahoma's lethal injection method is constitutional following a legal challenge from dozens of death row prisoners
description: Oklahoma's use of a three-drug lethal injection method is constitutional, a federal judge ruled Monday following a lawsuit from nearly 30 people on death row challenging the protocol.

title: Russia returns bodies of Ukrainian soldiers killed in Mariupol
description: Workers at Kyiv's central morgue examine 160 body bags containing the remains of Ukrainian soldiers, handed over by Russian forces as part of the agreement that ended the bloody two-month Russian siege of the port city of Mariupol. CNN's Ben Wedeman has the exclusive report.

title: Rare inlaid Stradivari violin could fetch $11 million at auction
description: A rare 1679 violin made by renowned Italian craftsman Antonio Stradivari is headed for auction next month where it could fetch up to $11 million.

title: Watergate legend calls Jan. 6 committee member 'sleeper of the hearing'
description: CNN political analyst Carl Bernstein explains Rep. Liz Cheney's (R-WY) importance in the upcoming January 6 committee hearings.

title: Trump campaign told fake Georgia electors to use 'complete secrecy'
description: The Trump campaign directed a group of Georgia Republicans to meet in secret and obscure their objectives in an email obtained by federal prosecutors as part of their recent investigation into Donald Trump's efforts to overturn the election in several swing states.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan release new photo of daughter Lilibet
description: Prince Harry and Meghan, The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, have released a new photo of their daughter Lilibet, after celebrating her 1st birthday on Saturday at Frogmore Cottage in Windsor in the UK, a spokesperson for the family said.

title: 'Explosive outbreaks': What Singapore's dengue emergency means for the world
description: Singapore says it is facing a dengue "emergency" as it grapples with an outbreak of the seasonal disease that has come unusually early this year.

title: 'Tumors just vanished': Cancer patients now in remission after drug trial
description: Treatment with the immunotherapy dostarlimab showed promising results in a small trial of a dozen rectal cancer patients, according to new research, but further study is needed and it is too early to call it a cure. CNN's Erin Burnett speaks to Dr. Andrea Cercek, an oncologist at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.

title: British journalist and Brazilian indigenous affairs expert missing in the Amazon
description: A veteran British journalist and a Brazilian indigenous affairs expert are missing in Brazil's remote Javari Valley, in the far western part of Amazonas state.
